title: Testimony of the Teachers
outcome: Teachers, once sidelined by algorithms, become community leaders. They initiate citywide seminars on recent system manipulation, bridging generations, exposing hidden histories, and steering public debate over Stenograd’s future.

events.description: Teachers and community volunteers organize open-air forums across districts, inviting citizens to discuss their personal histories with the BCI and its impact.
Children and parents share overlooked stories from the early BCI pilot era, revealing patterns of forced compliance and silent resistance. Crowds grow as word spreads.
Teachers step forward as trusted moral voices, facilitating debates and encouraging proposals for alternative governance by drawing on citizens’ lived experiences.
Council members argue over whether to outlaw unsanctioned public discussions. The Harmonists warn against crackdown, fearing backlash; Directorate officials push for reimposing strict order.

The first citywide popular assembly is held in central squares, organized spontaneously by educators. Citizens present a manifesto for transparent, participatory governance, directly challenging algorithmic authority.
